item.title: Haleon Site Visit | Oct. 29 (Registration Required)
item.description: Join the CCPD for a visit to Haleon’s Oak Hill manufacturing site in East Durham, NY on Wednesday, October 29th from 10am-1pm! You’ll be able to tour the facilities, learn about Haleon’s mission and values, and network with Haleon team members over a pizza lunch. Register in Handshake–transportation is provided but space is limited!

item.title: Fall 2025 School of Engineering Midterm Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Friday, October 10, 2025 (all day) - Fall 2025 School of Engineering (SoE) Midterm course evaluations are now open. item.title: Lally Co-Terminal Info Session for Computer Science Majors — FREE PIZZA + WINGS | Oct. 23
item.description: Oct. 23 | 6:00 PM | Lally 102 Stand out in a tough tech job market. Learn how to earn your MBA or M.S. at Lally while finishing your CS degree. Boost your résumé with business, leadership, and innovation skills that set you apart in AI, data, and software careers. We’ll cover program options, admissions steps, and how to make it work for you. Pizza + wings provided! Register Here- https://forms.gle/KUNPqVVAZo3VHjht8

item.title: New Minor in Quantum Computing Now Available
item.description: A new interdisciplinary minor is available for any student who wants to explore quantum computing. Students will gain both theoretical insight and practical exposure to quantum algorithms, hardware platforms, and the concept of quantum advantage, the point at which quantum systems outperform classical approaches on meaningful tasks. Minor requirements can be found in the RPI catalog. To discuss declaring this minor, please contact the School of Science Hub at ScienceHub@rpi.edu

item.title: Register for the Investiture of Shekhar Garde by Oct. 29
item.description: Join us November 5 as Dean Shekhar Garde formally assumes the first endowed deanship in RPI’s history, made possible through the generosity of Thomas R. Farino, Jr. ’67 and Patricia E. Farino. Please register online by Wednesday, October 29.

item.title: Webex vs Teams: Choosing the Right Tool for Your Campus Workflows | Oct. 24
item.description: The campus community has access to both Cisco Webex and Microsoft Teams, but which is best for your needs? Join us on Friday, October 24, 2025, 10-11:30am for a practical, fast-paced session comparing the strengths of each platform. Whether you’re teaching, hosting a symposium, collaborating on a grant proposal, or streamlining your team’s communication, we’ll help you match the right tool to the task. Register at https://rensselaer.webex.com/weblink/register/r4235dc39258dd1620e7365907d91af2d
item.author: Community

item.title: HASS Family Weekend Music Showcase on Saturday October 25
item.description: This program features the RPI Orchestra, Concert Choir, and Wind Symphony in a musical preview of works that will be included on the Dec. 6th RPI Holiday Concert, including Mark Camphouse’s “A Movement for Rosa”, Christopher Tin’s “Baba Yetu”, and Bedrich Smetana’s “Die Moldau”. Admission is free. Showcase starts at 2:30pm in DCC 308.

item.title: NSF GRFP Letters of Recommendation Due November 7th
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 23, 2025 (all day) - Letters of Recommendation for the NSF GRFP are due November 7th, BEFORE student application deadlines. All student applications should be reviewed by Betty Madigan to check for compliance with the NEW formatting requirements. Send statements at least a week before the deadline. Additionally, a faculty guide for writing letters of recommendation is available upon request. Requests for information and reviews should be sent to madige@rpi.edu.
